title:
Composite solitary vortices of three-wave mixing in quasi-phase-matched
  photonic crystals
authors:
Chao Kong, Jinqing Li, Xinyi Tang, Xuli Li, Ju Jiao, Jun Cao, and
  Haiming Deng
abstract:
We report the composite vortex solitons of three-wave mixing propagate stably
in a three-dimensional (3D) quasi-phase-matched photonic crystals (QPM-PhC).
The modulation of QPM-PhC is designed as a checkerboard pattern. The vortex
solitons, composed by three waves ($\omega_{1,2,3}$) propagating through the
lattices, exhibit a four-spotted discrete type, which gives rise to four
distinct modes: zero-vorticity, vortex, anti-vortex, and quadrupole. The
composite vortex solitons result from combinations of these modes and lead to
four cases: vortex doubling, hidden vortices, vortex up-conversion, and
anti-vortex up-conversion. Our findings indicate that all solitons can
propagate stably through the crystals for 10 centimeters; however, only the
vortex-doubling case remains stable over longer distances. This work enhances
the understanding of vortex beam manipulation within 3D QPM-PhCs.
